titleInfo.subTitle: Charles Aubrey Ricard oral history interview, 2005

name.description: Charles Ricard was born in 1930 in Baton Rouge, La., to Wilbert Ricard and Bessie DeCuir Ricard. He attended elementary school at St. Francis Xavier and graduated from Southern University Laboratory High School in 1948. His father, Wilbert, was a contractor and Ricard learned the trade from him. He went on to work for several building and construction firms in Baton Rouge. Ricard was widowed and met his second wife, Mary, in 1967. He has three children.

mods.abstract: Ricard discusses growing up in South Baton Rouge, describing local businesses, schools, and the physical and demographic makeup of the neighborhood. He gives specifics on the location of particular homes and businesses in the predominantly African-American neighborhood. He delves into his family's history of owning property in Downtown Baton Rouge since the 1910s or 1920s.
